frame.name: Connecting_architecture
frame.definition:
<def-root>An entity is integrated into a building as a <fen>Part</fen> of a (possibly unexpressed) <fen>Whole</fen> which may refer to the whole building or merely to a sub-part of the building. The <fen>Part</fen> itself connects locations within the building to each other, <fen>Connected_locations</fen>. If a particular point of view is adopted in the context of real or imagined motion, then one of the locations can be construed as <fen>Goal</fen> and the other as <fen>Source</fen>.
<ex>It was of great interest to me to see the star signs of Taurus the Bull and Leo the Lion on the <t><fex name="Part">staircase</fex></t> <fex name="Goal">to the upper Palace</fex>.</ex>
<ex>All visitors may use the <t><fex name="Part">elevator</fex></t> <fex name="cl">between the Main Level and the Upper Level</fex> instead of the main staircase</ex>
<ex>The <t><fex name="Part">window</fex></t> <fex name="Goal">into the garden</fex> was open.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Part</fen> of a larger architectural unit, the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex>Could you open the <t><fex name="Part">door</fex></t> for me, please?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition:
<def-root>An architectural unit which includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Whole">kitchen</fex> <t>door</t> came off its hinges</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A property relating to the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>People may give you weird looks as you struggle up the steps with your suitcase instead of using the <fex name="Dsc">slow</fex> <t>escalator</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Orientation
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is a property of the <fen>Part</fen> that situates the <fen>Part</fen> within the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex>We can let you in through the <fex name="Orientation">back</fex> <t>door</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Part</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.
<ex>The house has an <fex name="Material">oak</fex> <t>door</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Individual who creates the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>If <fex name="Creator">a caprenter's</fex> <t>door</t> is shoddy, is it always his fault?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is one of the <fen>Connected_locations</fen> treated as source.
<ex>Does <t>door</t> <fex name="src">from basement</fex> to living quarters have an adequate lock operated from living quarters side?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Connected_locations
FE.definition:
<def-root>Two or more named locations that are connected by the architectural <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex> Security in the <t>hallway</t> <fex name="cl">between the jail and the Court Building</fex> needs to be improved.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Direction</fen> is the direction or directions the <fen>Part</fen> of connecting architecture runs.
<ex>Please take the <fex name="">east west</fex> <t>stairs</t> down to the lower floor</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is one of the <fen>Connected_locations</fen> treated as a goal
<ex>Finally they corner us as we reach the <t>escalator</t> <fex name="Goal">to the first floor</fex>.</ex></def-root>
